item.description:
The Future is a Miranda July creation. Her last movie, Me and You and Everyone We Know, was beautiful and fantastical. I saw it at the Newport Film Festival, and I can still picture scenes from that movie because the visuals were so clear and insightful. I am really looking forward to her follow-up movie, The Future. Hamish Linklater, who plays July's husband in The Future, plays Julia Louis-Dreyfus's brother in the sitcom The New Adventures of Old Christine. It will be interesting to see him in this film. And, of course, there's the talking cat!

You can find out more about The Future at the theater website: http://www.landmarktheaters.com . If you click on the link for "Boston" on the left, then scroll down on the right to find the movie, you will also find a link for the movie's official website, where you can also find the trailer.

*****From the Landmark Theater's website:

In her follow-up to Me and You and Everyone We Know, internationally acclaimed artist, author, and filmmaker Miranda July returns with her moving and fearless drama The Future. When thirty-something couple Sophie (writer/director July) and Jason (Hamish Linklater) decide to adopt a stray cat, their perspective on life changes radically, literally altering the course of time and space and testing their faith in each other and themselves.

*****

I will purchase my ticket at about 6:45 p.m., then wait at the foot of the stairs in the theater lobby. Look for me and my bright red backpack. At about 7:00, I will move into the theater auditorium (can't miss the previews). You can find me there, if you are late. The movie starts at 7:10.

After the movie, I will wait in the theater lobby to gather everyone.

Please RSVP if you plan to attend this event.

Thanks! See you Thursday!

Marianne
item.how_to_find_us: Look for my bright red backpack. See the event description for more details.
